dish_description: The dish is a simplified version of cassoulet, a hearty French stew that typically includes beans, duck, and various types of sausage. In this version, different sausages are used along with beans, onions, garlic, and a garnish of tomato, garlic, and parsley.

cooking_steps.description: Start by adding a little bit of olive oil to a pot. Cut the Italian sausage into pieces and put them in the pot to cook.
Prepare the other sausages (bratwurst or kielbasa and a hot dog) by cutting them into pieces, but set them aside as they are already cooked and will be added later.
Chop an onion and garlic coarsely and add them to the pot with the cooking Italian sausage. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add a can of beans (cannellini, butter beans, or any white or red beans of choice) to the pot.
Pour water into the pot and cook for a couple of minutes, optionally covering the pot for 2 to 3 minutes.
While the beans are cooking, prepare a garnish with a piece of tomato, more garlic, and parsley, but do not add it to the pot yet.

Once the onions are cooked, add the previously set aside cooked sausages to the pot. Add a bit more water to rinse the can and bring everything to a boil for 1 to 2 minutes to warm up the sausages and beans.
Finally, add the garnish to the pot, stir, and bring back to a boil. Season with salt, pepper, and optionally a dash of Tabasco. Serve the cassoulet in a bowl, garnished with more herbs if desired.
